intro: Marlierea glabra, commonly known as the smooth marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
